summary:
"Everybody is a genius. But if you judge a fish by its ability to climb a tree, it will spend its whole life thinking its stupid" (Albert Einstein)

As an officer of the Royal Netherlands Navy, I held many different positions in the past 35 years of active service. Most challenging and interesting one is the job of an intelligence officer as to date.

Fifteen years ago, I took notice of the intelligence community by switching my traditional navy career, serving on the high seas, by applying my first intelligence specialist course in the United Kingdom and, as a result, conducting more landbase operations. 

My specialties are in the field of interacting with all kinds of people, have a genuine interest in other cultures, leadership and policy development, education and organizing/managing challenging projects and events. Emphasis is my experience in worldwide military theaters ranging from friendly to (semi) hostile environments.

In the summer of 2019 is my planned retirement.

awards.title: Médaille de bronze de la Défense nationale
awards.description:
La médaille de la Défense nationale est une décoration militaire française.

Elle a été créée par Charles Hernu1, ministre de la Défense et mise en place par le décret n°82-358 du 21 avril 1982 abrogé et remplacé par le décret n°2014-389 du 29 mars 2014. Elle récompense les services particulièrement honorables rendus par les militaires (d'active et de réserve) pour leur participation aux activités opérationnelles ou de préparation opérationnelle des armées et les interventions au profit des populations.

La médaille comporte trois échelons : or, argent et bronze. Elle comporte également des agrafes.
awards.issuer: Le Ministre Francais de la Défense

awards.title: Inhuldigingsmedaille Zijne Majesteit de Koning
awards.description:
De medaille wordt toegekend "aan personen die een bijzondere bijdrage hebben geleverd aan de inhuldiging, welke bijdrage hun dagelijkse werkzaamheden betekenisvol te boven gaat. Voorts wordt deze herinneringsmedaille toegekend aan een beperkt aantal personen die aanwezig zijn bij de inhuldigingsplechtigheid". Er behoort een oorkonde bij.
De toekenning geschiedt, zo bepaalt het Koninklijk Besluit, "op voordracht van de Minister van Binnenlandse Zaken en Koninkrijksrelaties, of in voorkomend geval op voordracht van de Minister van Buitenlandse Zaken, mede namens de Minister van Binnenlandse Zaken en Koninkrijksrelaties".

awards.title: Article 5 NATO medal for service with NATO in relation to Operation Active Endeavour
awards.description: Under Operation Active Endeavour, NATO ships patrolled the Mediterranean and monitored shipping to help deter, defend, disrupt and protect against terrorist activity. The operation evolved out of NATO’s immediate response to the terrorist attacks against the United States of 11 September 2001.

awards.title: NATO medal for Service with NATO on Operations in Relation to the Former Yugoslavia
awards.description: The Stabilisation Force in Bosnia and Herzegovina (SFOR) was a NATO-led multinational peacekeeping force deployed to Bosnia and Herzegovina after the Bosnian war. Although SFOR was led by NATO, several non-NATO countries contributed troops. It was replaced by EUFOR Althea in December 2004.

awards.title: Coast Guard Meritorious Unit Commendation to Operation Frontier Shield
awards.description: Operation Frontier Shield is the largest Coastguard led multi agency maritime law enforcement effort in executing Frontier Shield's goal of significant reducing the flow of drugs and migrants into the United States through Puerto Rican arrival zone.
awards.issuer: The Commandant of the United States Coast Guard Washington

awards.title: NATO medal for Service with NATO on Operations in Relation to the Former Yugoslavia

Although SFOR was led by NATO, several non-NATO countries contributed troops. It was replaced by EUFOR Althea in December 2004.

projects.title: Observer Trainer in an international training environment
projects.description: Every year, an international NATO Humint exercise is to be held in Romania. This exercise is called Steadfast Indicator and is directed by SHAPE and executed at the HUMINT Centre of Excellence (HCOE) in Oradea, Romania. About 20 countries participated in this exercise. Contributions consist of providing students, support and exercice control. My role was an observer trainer's one with the ultimate goal to raise the knowledge and understanding of Human Intelligence of international students to a higher level. A task which I filled with pleasure and which gave me the honor of best Observer Trainer of the exercise. Something to be proud of..

profile_positions.title: Nautical Director
Operations Officer (U3) at Observer Group Golan Tiberias

profile_positions.description:
UN Military Observers (UNMOs) are un-armed and are trained to observe and report violations of the agreements of ceasefire, disengagement, etc., relevant to their areas of operation. All military observers are seasoned officers in the rank of captain or major, coming from all branches of service in their respective countries’ armed forces. 26 Nations contribute to UNTSO with a total of 153 military personnel, including 15 female officers. They work in multi-national teams, so that any observations are confirmed by at least two observers from different nations to guarantee impartiality.

UNTSO currently provides military observers to two UN missions in the area: Observer Group Lebanon (OGL), which supports UNIFIL in south Lebanon, and Observer Group Golan (OGG), supporting UNDOF in the Golan. OGG maintains its headquarters co-located with UNDOF HQ in Camp Ziouani, on the Occupied Golan, and is split into two outstations: Observer Group Golan – Damascus (OGG-D) and Observer Group Golan – Tiberias (OGG-T), based in those respective areas. 

Each outstation staffs a number of Observation Posts on each side of the Area of Separation (AOS) as part of the 1974 Disengagement Agreement between Syria and Israel following the 1973 October War. The military observers carry out fortnightly inspections in the Area of Limitation (AOL) to verify that both sides adhere to the limitations on troop levels and military equipment within 10, 20 and 25 km zones from the AOS as prescribed by the 1974 Disengagement Agreement.  OGG-D recommenced operational activities in August 2016 from the outskirts of Damascus, Syria. 

OGL HQ is co-located with UNIFIL HQ in Naqoura, south Lebanon. OGL operates out of UNIFIL bases and patrols along the "Blue Line", a line of Israeli withdrawal between the parties, Israel and Lebanon, in 2000.
profile_positions.title: United Nations Military Observer Middle East

profile_positions.description:
JISTARC (Joint Intelligence, Surveillance, Target Acquisition and Reconnaissance Command) is an intelligence asset located in ' t Harde, The Netherlands. That Command collects, analyzes and disseminates information in a deployment area. This unit specifically helps Commanders on the spot when planning operations and in decision-making-processes. 105 Field HUMINT squadron is an intelligence sensor, subordinate to the JISTARC staf. 

During missions, there is always a need for information. People are continuously looking for answers to important questions, which ultimately should lead to a proper assessment of the threat in a given area. It is the job of a Field Humint Team (FHT) to seek answers to these questions of the Commander. The FHT is looking for the right people who may be able to answer these questions, The FHT collects the necessary information from the conversations with these sources and subsequently makes a report for disseminating by means of the appropriate systems. 

The second task for the FHT is delivering Operational Interrogators for the entire armed forces. 

As deputy commander of this operational intelligence asset, I'm monitoring, maintaining and planning operational intelligence needs originating from higher command.
profile_positions.title: Dep Commander 105 Field HUMINT squadron Joint ISTAR Command (JISTARC)

profile_positions.description:
During this period I specified my responsibilities in two areas. My first field was the responsibility for having the lead in giving the right direction of annual events, conferences and symposia in the conference centre of the Naval Barracks. Eye-catching was surely the first edition of the Amsterdam City Swim. A fundraiser for the serious muscle disease ALS. The naval barracks functioned as the logistics and hospitality hub in a prominent role. The military support of that event was under my leadership.

In addition, I was the liaison officer of the naval barracks. In that position I established and maintained external contacts varying in wide range. These include the city counsel, Amsterdam police, security services, authorities of Port of Amsterdam, IJmuiden pilot service, logistics suppliers, embassies and consulates. I received a high French decoration as part of my outstanding performance and relationship with the French embassy. Very honored to receive such a reward
profile_positions.title: Head of events and Liaison Officer Naval Barracks Amsterdam

profile_positions.description:
At that time I was an instructor in the courses Human Intelligence (also known as the Contact Handlers Course) and the military interrogator course. The challenging but also great impulse about this feature lays the fact that new students starts from scratch to what they are right now, true professionals. Traveling that path is not an easy one. E.g. before attending the courses the candidates must succeed a one day long psychological assessment and a three days period of practical tests. During the Contact Handlers Course, training skills they are taught in are communication techniques, non verbal communication, behavior symptoms analyses, working with interpreters, planning operations, anti and counter surveillance, written reports and much, much more. 

I also supported other training facilities at the Defense Intelligence Institute, particularly by acting as guest lecturer or by showing up as role player. As a role player, I was active in the Counter Intelligence courses and Conduct After Capture trainings on C-level.
profile_positions.title: Instructor Human Intelligence and Operational Military Interrogation

profile_positions.description:
I was employed as a dep staff officer and liaison officer under the command of Commander Naval Forces in the Caribbean and Commander Taskgroup 4.4. My responsibilities consisted roughly of the following aspects. 

1. Plans of the operational assets in the annual program 
2. Monitor and report the operational readiness state of all units under the command of the Naval Commander in the Caribbean. 
3. Participating scheduled national and international conferences, including the Joint Interagency Task Force South (JIATF-S) in Key West, Florida in the context of counter drugs operations. 
4. liaison officer linking with all external stakeholders in the Caribbean, like consulates, the Dutch representative in the Netherlands Antilles, the Governors household, Port Authorities and shipping agencies.

The visit of Her Majesty the Queen of the Netherlands and her entourage on the Netherlands Antilles and Aruba pinpointed me as an absolute highlight. As one of the two liaison officers I was responsible, together with the staff of her Majesty, to lead the visit runs smoothly. For almost two weeks I have been traveling extensively with the organizing committee and the Royal Family's staff. The military deployment consisted of personnel, the West Indien Guard ship, the Coast Guard stations on the islands and their patrol boats and some helicopters. An experience I will never forget.
profile_positions.title: Dep Staff Officer Planning & Control and Liaison Officer

profile_positions.description: Started as intelligence naval analyst and ended in the operational field
profile_positions.title: Intelligence Analyst and Operations Specialist

profile_positions.description: For twenty-one years I have held various (operational) employments. Started as a young radar operator moved on to link controller. Further specialized in weapon controller, aircontroller and anti surface and subsurface warfare. Just before my intelligence move was definite, I finished in the position of Chief Operations in the Combat Information Centre (CIC) of HNLMS Van Speijk. All these functions are in different CIC's of the Dutch frigates.
profile_positions.title: Several specialist employments

volunteer_experiences.description: Under the leadership and guidance of the executive organization House of Sports, acting as liaison between the personnel of the naval barracks Amsterdam and House of Sports. On the day itself, I was responsible for executing a smooth way of receiving the thousands of swimmers on the military terrain as where the start of the swim challenge is.

Sportiness, performance and enjoyment. That's what Squashoorn stands for. With a membership of approximately 300, it is one of the larger squash clubs in the Netherlands. The members practice the sport recreational or competitive. The number of league teams is five, with a 1st national division's team. Squashoorn organizes several annual activities and tournaments for its members. 

During that period I was the Chairman of the club. Together with my executive committee I was responsible for rewriting the mission statement, the club's bylaws, financial reconstructions and presiding the annual members meeting. In all we succeeded and the club is as it is right now, top of the bill.
